front.title: Transport Layer Security (TLS) Session Hash and Extended Master Secret Extension

abstract.t: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) master secret is not cryptographically bound to important session parameters. Consequently, it is possible for an active attacker to set up two sessions, one with a client and another with a server, such that the master secrets on the two sessions are the same. Thereafter, any mechanism that relies on the master secret for authentication, including session resumption, becomes vulnerable to a man-in-the- middle attack, where the attacker can simply forward messages back and forth between the client and server. This specification defines a TLS extension that contextually binds the master secret to a log of the full handshake that computes it, thus preventing such attacks.
